intro: Atriplex recurva, commonly known as silverleaf chenopod, is a perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its gray-green, succulent leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its root system is extensive and adapted to nutrient-poor soils, allowing it to thrive in harsh desert conditions. Atriplex recurva plays an important role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
